title: Recent homes sales in Greater Boston (Sept. 10)
author: The Boston Globe
bullets: A home on Camp St. in Abington, built in 1983, sold for $710,000. It has 4 bedrooms, 2 baths.
A one-family antique in Andover built in 1754 sold for $2,825,000 on a 68,041-square-foot lot.
A newly built condo town house on Bailey Pond Lane in Amesbury sold for $1,049,000 with 3 bedrooms.

title: Here’s who will be on the ballot for November’s 2025 City Council election
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: The Boston City Council election will be held on November 4, with multiple candidates advancing from the preliminary round.
Incumbent Ruthzee Louijeune leads the at-large city council race with 17.65% of the vote; eight candidates advance to November.
District 7's tight race sees Mavrick Afonso leading with 15.45%, followed closely by Samuel Hurtado and Said Coach Ahmed.

title: Mayoral preliminary: Wu maintains huge lead over Kraft as both advance to November election
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Mayor Michelle Wu led Boston's preliminary mayoral election, earning over 26,400 more votes than her opponent, Josh Kraft.
Josh Kraft, backed by his father Robert Kraft, vowed to continue campaigning aggressively for the November mayoral election.
Preliminary election saw nearly 18% voter turnout with over 75,000 ballots cast, according to the Boston Elections Department.

title: What to know about the viral surrogacy lawsuit
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Venture capitalist Cindy Bi sued surrogate Rebecca Smith after a miscarriage, alleging she killed the child.
Bi's aggressive actions included legal battles and harassment, leading Smith to relocate and change jobs.
The case highlights potential pitfalls in surrogacy arrangements and growing legal concerns as the industry expands.

title: A healthy Hampus Lindholm could change Bruins’ fortunes in several areas
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Hampus Lindholm returns to Bruins' training camp healthy after a kneecap injury kept him out for most of 2024-2025.
Bruins coach Marco Sturm will rely on Lindholm to strengthen a weak power play, which ranked 29th at 15.2% last season.
Despite previous injuries, Lindholm aims to bolster Bruins' defense and contribute offensively, particularly in power plays with David Pastrnak.

title: Drake Maye receives a ringing endorsement from Bills QB Josh Allen
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bills QB Josh Allen praised Patriots QB Drake Maye on the 'Like a Farmer' podcast, highlighting his talent and personality.
Drake Maye and Josh Allen are set to face each other in Weeks 5 and 15 of the NFL season.
Josh Allen, who has watched Maye's development, previously lauded him as one of his favorite young quarterbacks.

title: MBTA debuts train design to honor historic New England railroad, with more on the way
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: MBTA debuts a Boston and Maine Railroad design on a commuter train, using vintage maroon and yellow colors and emblem.
The MBTA plans to release two additional historic-themed trains, honoring New Haven Railroad and New York Central Railroad by year-end.
The refurbished trains include upgrades like remote monitoring and diagnostics, forward-facing cameras, and modern brake systems.

title: Patriots could be facing off against their former 1st-round pick in Miami
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Cole Strange is joining the Miami Dolphins from the Cleveland Browns' practice squad ahead of their game against the Patriots.
Strange was a first-round pick for the Patriots in 2022, but his tenure was impacted by injuries and performance issues.
The Dolphins signed Strange after starting guard James Daniels sustained a pectoral injury in their Week 1 loss to the Colts.

title: Tufts to go tuition-free for families making less than $150K
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Tufts University will offer free tuition to undergraduates from families earning less than $150,000 starting next fall.
Families earning under $60,000 will receive aid packages without student loans, covering full tuition and financial need.
The initiative, funded by donors, aims to increase diversity and affordability, with $143 million set for financial aid in 2026.

title: Aunt now caring for young daughter of parents killed in Watertown murder-suicide
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Karine Asatryan and Nadia Abrahamian were killed in a Watertown murder-suicide by David Minasvand.
Karine Asatryan's 1-year-old daughter Madeline will be cared for by her aunt, Meline Asatryan.
A fundraiser for Madeline has raised over $37,000 for baby supplies, medical care, and future education.
